title: The Seven-Day Impeachment
summary: The best outcome now is to make the House vote the end with no Senate trial.. Democrats rushed through their second impeachment of President Trump on Wednesday, with less than a week left before he exits the Oval Office. The exercise is mostly about making a political statement since it will have no other practical effect, though it might stir up more public anger and discord.

title: Connecticut Investigating Amazon's E-Book Business
summary: State attorney general looking into whether tech giant's dealings with certain publishers are anticompetitive. Connecticut is actively investigating how Amazon.com Inc. sells and distributes digital books, according to the state's attorney general, the latest of several state and federal probes into the tech giant's business practices.

title: Trump Impeachment Deepens GOP Divide
summary: Mitch McConnell and Kevin McCarthy are taking different stances on punishing the president, and the split is rippling through the party. WASHINGTON-The Capitol riot and the impeachment of President Trump have divided the GOP from the top down, with the party's two congressional leaders, state party officials and longtime donors taking different stances on punishing the president as his term ends.

title: An Antitrust History Lesson
summary: How trust busters botched the Staples-Office Depot merger.. Five years ago the Federal Trade Commission broke up the Staples- Office Depot merger attempt. Its dubious complaint is worth revisiting now as Staples tries again to get hitched to Office Depot to compete with Amazon .

title: Banks Make a Climate Offering
summary: The lobby for Big Finance delivers tribute to Team Biden.. Whenever an invader conquered new lands in ancient times, the local tribes made a pilgrimage to offer tribute to the new king. title: Private-Equity Firm New Mountain Capital Raises Over $10 Billion for Deals

title: Huntsville Chosen as Home to U.S. Space Command
summary: Alabama's 'Rocket City' selected from six finalists; Air Force to make final decision after environmental-impact studies. title: Bill Belichick's Day Off
summary: A coaching legend makes a choice, leading to an uncharacteristically quiet week. Bill Belichick has a day off. Even in placid times, this would be news, because this is the part of year when the Grumpy Lobster Boat Captain is ordinarily in his wheelhouse, hauling pots, steering in a hard, cold rain, trying to guide his New England Patriots to the Super Bowl for the five hundred billionth zillionth jillionth time.

title: Is Nancy Pelosi a Mad Genius?
summary: The House speaker knows one political reality: Increase her vote and diminish the opposition's.. We read, correctly, that the country is being torn apart by hyperpartisan politics, by the invasion of the Capitol last week, by the summer's urban riots, and by the second impeachment of President Trump. While these matters preoccupy citizens concerned about the future of their republic, as they should, bear in mind a less emotive truism about democracy: All political battles must end with voter turnout.

title: Trump Has One Thing Left to Do
summary: He's wrong to skip the inauguration, but he can still discourage any further violence.. Donald Trump won't be the first president to skip his successor's inauguration.

summary: A blockbuster NBA deal unites Harden with Kevin Durant and Kyrie Irving on a Nets team that could win a title-if they can learn to coexist. James Harden, Kevin Durant and Kyrie Irving now play for the same NBA team. What could go wrong?

summary: Agencies are using the technology to identify the Capitol rioters.. Federal, state and local law-enforcement agencies are using facial-recognition technology to identify the members of the mob that assaulted the U.S. Capitol last week.

title: 'Drug Use for Grown-Ups' Review: A Dose of Dissent
summary: For people who can control their impulses and regulate their emotions-so it is argued-the use of drugs, including heroin, can have good effects.. In a referendum in November, Oregon became the first state to decriminalize the possession of small amounts of heroin, cocaine, methamphetamine and LSD. The move was inspired by a 2001 law in Portugal that removed incarceration as a penalty for drug possession. To judge by "Drug Use for Grown-Ups," Carl Hart welcomed this news, which came too late for him to mention in his provocative and enlightening book. He opens with the announcement: "I am an unapologetic drug user."

title: Google's Fake Union Insults the Labor Movement
summary: Alphabet has no legal obligation to recognize or negotiate with the well-funded pressure group.. The "union" formed by workers last week at Google parent company Alphabet isn't really a labor union in the traditional sense. Rather it's a pressure group funded by the Communications Workers of America, which will provide staff and support to generate negative publicity about management at the Mountain View, Calif., company. The so-called Alphabet Workers Union is composed of fewer than 800 workers among Alphabet's roughly 250,000 employees and contractors, some of whom are technically employed by completely separate entities, some of which are already unionized.

title: Humor Begins to Clear My Family's Covid Brain Fog
summary: It took a little cross-multiplication, but we're getting better.. Covid-19 descended on my household the week before Christmas, a fitting end to 2020. The symptoms, while miserable for those of us afflicted, could have been much worse. I am, after all, gratefully able to write this piece.

title: Facebook Turned on Trump After Internal Warning Signs Surged
summary: Following surge in reports of violent content ahead of Capitol attack, executives took their most aggressive steps yet to rein in the president and his supporters. While grocery shopping at Giant Food in Washington, D.C., the 31-year-old paralegal passed by the in-store pharmacist who was scrambling to find takers for two doses after a pair of health-care workers missed their appointments. title: When Media Censorship Only Runs One Way
summary: You've chosen to interpret recent actions by social-media and technology companies as a "progressive purge." Another view is that these private companies are doing exactly what they believe is in the best interest of their corporations and their shareholders.. Regarding your editorial "The Progressive Purge Begins" (Jan. 11): President Xi Jinping of the Chinese Communist Party shuts down Google, Facebook and Twitter in China, blocking information to 1.4 billion people. Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey closes the sitting president's account, blocking information to his 88 million direct followers plus countless others via redistribution. Amazon blocks books based on their authors' political viewpoint. Google and Apple block Parler. Twitter blocked the New York Post, though they later relented. What master are they serving?

title: On the Increasing Irrelevance of U.S. Coins
summary: No one carries coins around anymore because they have become essentially worthless.. Stephen Moore's "America Is Willing to Pay for Change" (op-ed, Dec. 30) on the American coin shortage only addresses part of the problem with coin circulation in our country. The real elephant in the room is the fact that no one carries coins around anymore because they have become essentially worthless. Our politicians are loath to admit that decades of inflation have made American coinage worth less than Monopoly money, so why would anyone bother to carry coins around in their daily lives? This is even more true today, when we have debit and credit cards, and smartphone pay apps.

title: Should You Wear Mules Outside the House?
summary: Some say backless shoes are slovenly. Others insist they're stylish. A menswear editor and sports columnist debate the merits of new, open-heel shoes from Nike, Gucci, Reebok and more.. Many were peculiar, backless models. These "you don't even need to lift your heel" mules might suit a life of slovenly at-home shuffling. But are any stylish enough to wear outside? summary: David built a joint fortune with his twin brother Frederick, with whom his family had recently sparred. LONDON-David Barclay, the secretive British billionaire who, with his twin brother, built a property and media empire before a spectacular and public falling out, has died.

title: Why 'Candyman' and 'Captain Marvel 2' Director Nia DaCosta Will Make History in 2021
summary: A new Marvel Studios director-the first Black woman to hold the role-on her love of horror movies and collaborating with Jordan Peele. In WSJ. Magazine's series "12 for '21," we highlight a dozen of the most creative artists and entertainers working today-all poised to have a breakout 2021.

title: Bugs Are Safe for Humans to Eat, Says EU
summary: Overcoming the 'yuck factor' could determine whether Europeans embrace edible insects. Insects are inching their way to becoming a menu item on European dining tables after the bloc's food safety regulator approved mealworms as safe for human consumption.

title: Prosecutors Say Wealth, Fame Motivated Theranos Founder's Alleged Crimes
summary: Two sides spar over what evidence jurors can see during criminal fraud trial in July. Before blood-testing company Theranos Inc. collapsed, founder Elizabeth Holmes was the darling of Silicon Valley's startup world. She graced magazine covers, drew comparisons with Apple Inc. co-founder Steve Jobs, and, for a while, sat on a fortune valued at $4.5 billion.

title: What Will Biden's Covid-19 Stimulus Plan Look Like?
summary: Thursday, the president-elect will unveil a pandemic relief plan worth 'trillions of dollars'; more checks for households, more money for states. President-elect Joe Biden says he plans to detail Thursday the first major legislation of his incoming administration: a massive new stimulus and relief package meant to address the continuing economic fallout from the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Dollar General Will Pay Workers to Get a Covid-19 Vaccine
summary: Retailer is one of the first to dangle extra pay to staff to encourage them to get coronavirus shots once available. Dollar General Corp. is offering employees a deal: Go get a Covid-19 vaccine and receive four hours of pay.

title: Qualcomm Bolsters 5G Ambitions With Planned $1.4 Billion Acquisition
summary: Purchase of chip startup Nuvia, founded by Apple engineers, comes amid chip deal-making frenzy. Mobile-phone chip giant Qualcomm Inc. said Wednesday that it has agreed to acquire a chip startup founded by former Apple Inc. engineers, adding to a wave of deals remaking the semiconductor industry.

title: Etsy's Cup May Have Runneth Over
summary: Online marketplace has surged in the Covid-19 pandemic, but offline rivals are likely to reopen this year. Crafting has turned into catnip for investors, but the high can't last forever.

title: American Priest Turned Lawyer in Hong Kong Faces China's Wrath but Keeps the Faith
summary: Resume Subscription. HONG KONG-In the 1960s, John Clancey was sent to Hong Kong from a small town in New York state to be a priest ministering to the city's working poor. He stayed and ultimately turned himself into an advocate for the city's powerless people.

title: After Capitol Riot, GOP Faces Reckoning with Corporate America
summary: The Republican Party has already seen its share of corporate PAC donations shrink compared with eight years ago. WASHINGTON-The challenge by some Republicans to the 2020 election results last week is fueling a rift between the party and big companies and could accelerate changes to the GOP's fundraising base.

title: Opendoor's Window Appears to Be Closing
summary: Pandemic erodes online real-estate platform's first-mover advantage. What's more risky than betting on one pandemic frenzy? Automated home flipper Opendoor Technologies embodies three of them at the same time.

title: Universal Licenses Catalog to Equinox Fitness App Variis
summary: Music has become critical to online fitness services amid Covid-19 pandemic; instructors have become like DJs. Vivendi SE 's Universal Music Group has licensed the world's largest music catalog to Equinox Media LLC's Variis digital fitness app, allowing users to work out at home to hits by Taylor Swift, Lady Gaga, Ariana Grande, Billie Eilish and the Weeknd.

title: Target Boosts Holiday Sales in Pandemic
summary: Online sales more than doubled in November and December while store-based sales ticked higher. Target Corp. said Wednesday that winter holiday sales rose solidly as more shoppers bought goods online, adding to a series of strong results from the retailer during the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Bitcoin Will Break Wall Street's Heart
summary: Mainstream institutional investors are coming to the party late, and conservative mandates mean outsize risk relative to potential returns. The gyrating price of bitcoin has made headlines again this year, as has growing interest from institutional investors. But most vanilla financiers have more to lose than win by diving into digital assets.

title: Federal Agencies Pushed Chinese Covid Tests Despite Warnings
summary: U.S. intelligence officials have said publicly that BGI products pose privacy risks. At least two federal agencies worked to distribute Covid-19 tests from a Chinese genetics company, despite warnings about security risks from U.S. intelligence and security officials, according to interviews and documents obtained by The Wall Street Journal.

title: SPAC Mania Gives Early Investors Steady Returns
summary: Hedge funds score gains when blank-check companies rise after announcing deals to take startups public. Sudden excitement about the flurry of startups going public through so-called blank-check companies is enriching some of the biggest players in finance, particularly hedge funds.

title: Crypto Company BitGo Hires Coinbase's Former Compliance Chief
summary: BitGo is seeking approval from New York regulators to act as a cryptocurrency custodian. BitGo Inc. has recruited the former chief compliance officer of virtual currency exchange Coinbase Inc. as the digital asset financial services provider seeks a key custodial license from New York state regulators.

title: More Trust in Business Than in Government and Media, Survey Finds
summary: In latest annual trust survey, U.S. respondents back business at a higher percentage than other institutions. People have more faith in their own employer than leaders in government and business, according to a new study released Wednesday.

title: Delayed Vaccine Rollout Spells Risk for Debt Investors
summary: Risky companies raised nearly $700 billion in debt financing from investors last year. Delays in administering Covid-19 vaccine shots pose a fresh risk to investors who bet on a speedy vaccination process to help risky U.S. companies bounce back from the pandemic.

title: Forgiving Student Debt by Executive Action Illegal, Trump Lawyers Say
summary: Congressional Democrats have urged Biden to forgive most or all of Americans' student debt unilaterally. Trump administration lawyers have concluded that it would be illegal to forgive all or some of Americans' student debt through an executive action-as congressional Democrats have urged the incoming Biden administration to do-arguing that such a move would require Congress to pass a law.

title: Investors Bet U.K. Stocks Can Banish Brexit Blues
summary: Main British stock index has climbed nearly 8% in dollar terms since the start of December, outperforming the S&P 500 and other major benchmarks. British stocks have enjoyed a world-beating rally since the start of December, with international investors beginning to buy back into one of their least-loved countries.

title: Lisa Montgomery Is Executed After Supreme Court Ruling
summary: She is the first woman to be put to death by federal authorities in almost 70 years. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court authorized the execution of Lisa Montgomery, the first female inmate to be put to death by federal authorities in nearly 70 years.

title: Boeing to Pay $25 Million in Drone Settlement
summary: Civil settlement resolves allegations used parts were substituted for new ones. Boeing Co. 's drone unit has agreed to pay $25 million to settle civil-fraud allegations that it overcharged on more than half a dozen contracts signed with the U.S. Navy and special forces between 2009 and 2017.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: New York Nursing Homes See Surge in Covid-19 Deaths
summary: Recent outbreaks have been in central and western New York, where areas around Buffalo, Rochester and Syracuse are hot spots. After a summertime slowdown, the coronavirus cut a deadly trail through New York nursing homes in December, killing more than 200 residents statewide in each of the last three weeks of the month, according to federal data.

title: Pence Says He Won't Invoke 25th Amendment
summary: House Democrats pass a resolution demanding that Pence and a majority of the cabinet invoke the amendment. WASHINGTON-Vice President Mike Pence rejected a push from Democrats to invoke the 25th Amendment to oust President Trump over his role in the Capitol riot, setting in motion a House vote Wednesday to impeach the president during his final week in office, this time with the support of some Republicans.

title: Biden to Appoint Acting Agency Heads Due to Transition Delays
summary: President-elect to put in place career officials in dozens of positions after inauguration. WASHINGTON-President-elect Joe Biden intends to appoint acting agency heads across the federal government once he takes office because of delays to his transition and Senate consideration of his nominees, transition officials said Tuesday.

title: Hackers' Attack on Email Security Company Raises New Red Flags
summary: Customers of Mimecast were targeted in cyberattack, showing the multiple layers of potential victims at risk in massive hack. A breach at email security provider Mimecast Inc. underscores that Russia-linked hackers appear to have targeted victims along multiple avenues of attack in what is shaping up to be one of the most successful cyber campaigns of U.S. government and corporate systems.

title: Vol. 33, No. 12: D.C. Change
summary: Most Popular News. With Inauguration Day coming on Jan. 20, here is a compilation of some Wall Street Journal style rules that pertain to the new administration.

title: FBI Has Opened Over 160 Cases Tied to Pro-Trump Capitol Riot
summary: Prosecutors are looking at sedition charges in connection with storming of the Capitol, which top military leaders call an assault on the Constitution. WASHINGTON-The nation's military leadership on Tuesday denounced last week's storming of the Capitol by a pro-Trump mob as a plot to overthrow the government, while federal prosecutors said they were examining more than 160 cases and weighing sedition charges in some of them.

title: Supreme Court Restores Mandate That Women Pick Up Abortion Drugs in Person
summary: Lower court had suspended requirement due to coronavirus hazards. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court Tuesday reinstated requirements that women seeking medication abortions make in-person visits to pick up their prescriptions, siding with the Trump administration over medical organizations that argued the mandate exposes patients to needless risks during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Cuba Named a State Sponsor of Terrorism by Trump Administration
summary: Move rescinds Obama administration's lifting of designation in 2015; Democrats denounce decision as politicized. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration is putting Cuba back on the list of countries considered state sponsors of terrorism, rescinding a 2015 move by the Obama administration to thaw ties to the onetime Cold War adversary.

title: The FBI's Violence Warning
summary: Officials need to be prepared for the worst through Jan. 20.. The storming of the U.S. Capitol last week has left millions of Americans wondering about the health of their democracy. Now imagine the damage if this is followed by political violence across the country leading up to the inauguration.

title: Chinese Covid-19 Vaccine Far Less Effective Than Initially Touted in Brazil
summary: Results of Sinovac's shot were almost 30 percentage points lower than previously announced, as concerns grow over study's transparency. SÃO PAULO-China's effort to boost its image by providing Covid-19 vaccines to the developing world suffered a setback after one of its leading inoculation candidates turned out to be 50% effective in late-stage trials in Brazil, significantly lower than earlier results showed.

title: Visa Abandons Plaid Acquisition After DOJ Challenge
summary: Justice Department sued in November to challenge the $5.3 billion deal. Visa Inc. abandoned its $5.3 billion planned acquisition of financial-technology firm Plaid Inc. amid a Justice Department antitrust lawsuit that challenged the deal.

title: J&J Opposes Former Talc Supplier's Bankruptcy Plan
summary: Johnson & Johnson says Imerys Talc America let people with talc claims dictate their damages. Imerys SA is pressing ahead in an effort to get out from under lawsuits over its U.S. mining operation, Imerys Talc America Inc., over the protests of health-care company Johnson & Johnson .

title: What Trump Said to Supporters on Jan. 6 Before Their Capitol Riot
summary: Democrats, seeking to impeach the president, say his comments incited the crowd to storm the building while lawmakers were certifying Biden's election.

title: ArcLight-Backed SPAC Connects With E-Bus Maker Proterra
summary: The private-equity firm's blank-check company has agreed to combine with the electric vehicle maker at a $1.6 billion valuation. A blank-check company backed by energy investment firm ArcLight Capital Partners agreed to acquire and take public electric vehicle company Proterra Inc. in a deal that gives it an enterprise value of about $1.6 billion.

title: FuboTV Bets on Sports Gambling to Draw In Customers
summary: Sports-rich live-TV provider agrees to buy sportsbook Vigtory in effort to generate more revenue and keep viewers engaged. FuboTV Inc. is buying an online sportsbook, a deal that makes the over-the-internet TV provider the latest sports-rich media company to invest in sports gambling in an effort to attract and retain viewers.

title: Cancer Death Rate in U.S. Falls by Largest Yearly Amount on Record
summary: Powerful new lung-cancer treatments helped propel overall declines in recent years. The death rate from cancer in the U.S. dropped 2.4% from 2017 to 2018, the biggest single-year decline on record and a sign of the impact of new treatments on lung cancer especially, the American Cancer Society said.

title: AI Startup Sees Opportunity Forecasting Pandemic-Era Consumer Demand
summary: New York-based Centricity, which uses AI algorithms to analyze consumer behavior, is aiming to raise $10 million in venture-capital money. Centricity Inc., a startup that uses artificial intelligence to help companies predict consumer demand for specific products in particular communities, is expected to raise $10 million in new venture-capital money this year.

title: U.S. Expected to Require Covid-19 Tests for All International Visitors
summary: Directive expands CDC order requiring proof of negative coronavirus tests for all airline passengers from U.K.. The U.S. government will require all international airline passengers to show proof of a negative Covid-19 test before boarding flights to the country, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said Tuesday.
